input_text:
Job Title: Staff Navigation Engineer

Location: San Carlos, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Who We Are

Noah Medical is building the future of medical robotics. Our next generation robotic platform targets early diagnosis and treatment of patients across multiple indications. We are looking for exceptional engineers and key team members. Our incredibly talented team of engineers, innovators, and industry leaders bring years of experience from the top healthcare companies in the world, including: Intuitive, Auris, Stryker, Johnson & Johnson, Boston Scientific, Verb Surgical, Mako, Think Surgical, Medrobotics, and Hansen. We are looking for talented, motivated and ambitious team members to revolutionize robotic surgery.

About The Team

The Navigation Team is a dynamic group of experts dedicated to revolutionizing the way medical professionals navigate complex anatomies and deliver targeted interventions. We serve as the driving force behind the development, testing, and optimization of advanced navigation systems utilized in critical medical procedures. We leverage state-of-the-art technologies from other industries and innovate to solve our unique problems. With a shared passion for precision and a commitment to advancing healthcare, we are trailblazing a new era of accuracy, safety, and success in medical navigation.

As a Staff Navigation Engineer, you will be responsible for demonstrating technical expertise on software and hardware componentes under R&D as well as deployed in the field. Your primary goals will be to research new algorithmic components, iterate on existing features, resolve software related issues, perform comprehensive performance analysis, and develop tools to help drive the product forward. You will collaborate closely with internal teams, including software developers, technicians, and customer service representatives, to help deliver high quality patient outcomes.

A Day In The Life Of Our Staff Navigation Engineer:

Algorithm Development: Research, develop, evaluate and iterate algorithms related to navigation within the human body.Software Development: Implement high quality algorithmic and software modules in product software systems interfacing with other modules. Create tools for visualization and performance analysis.Troubleshooting: Identify, diagnose, and resolve software-related issues reported by both internal and external users.Documentation: Create and maintain accurate documentation of technical design, evaluation protocols, issue resolutions, and customer interactions.Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams, including software developers and customer support, to escalate and resolve complex issues efficiently.Field Support: Investigate critical issues observed in the field and work with field service engineers to analyze new sites.Feedback Collection: Gather both internal and external feedback on software performance, user experience, and feature requests to improve future iterations.

About You

Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. An advanced degree (MS, PhD) is preferred. Relevant certifications are a plus. Minimum of five to eight years of experience in a relevant field.Technical Skills: Mastery of software development with C# and Python, along with an advanced understanding of mathematics and algorithms. Proven ability to quickly learn and adapt to new tools and technologies.Technical Expertise: Hands-on experience in one or more of the following areas:Geometric computer vision related to camera calibration, stereo reconstruction, pose estimation, robust estimation, numerical optimization, structure from motion or SLAMSensor categorization, calibration, sensor filtering, sensor fusion, , and probabilistic roboticsImage and point cloud registrationDeep Learning for computer vision or medical image analysis3D graphics and renderingProblem-Solving: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with a track record of solving complex technical challenges efficiently.Adaptability: Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks simultaneously, and thrive in a dynamic environment.Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely. Experience in presenting technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Collaboration: Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and resolve complex software issues, provide technical guidance, and perform design or code reviews.

Workplace Type:  Hybrid

Benefits & Perks (For Full Time Employees)

Competitive SalaryComprehensive health insurance including Medical, Dental and Vision + HSA and FSA optionsEquity & Bonus ProgramLife Insurance (company paid & supplemental) and Disability insuranceMental health support through medical insurance programsLegal and Pet Insurance12+ paid holidays, 15-20 days of PTO + use-what-you-need sick daysPaid parental leaveIn-office snacks and beverages In-office lunch stipendLearning & Development Opportunities: On-demand online training and book reimbursementTeam building and company organized social and celebration events

Pay Transparency

The Pay Range for this position is listed. Consistent with applicable laws, an employee's pay within this range is based on a number of factors which include but are not limited to relevant education, skills, job-related knowledge, qualifications, work experience, credentials, and/or geographic location of the posted role. Noah Medical reserves the right to modify this range as needed based on candidate experience level and/or specialized skills. Please note that the aforementioned range is only one component of the position's total compensation package.

California Pay Range

$175,200—$219,000 USD

Noah Medical may offer remote, hybrid, or onsite work arrangements within the state of California depending on the specific team and/or role where applicable.

Noah Medical is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to ensuring an inclusive environment for our employees. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex or gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, age, genetic information, physical or mental disability, marital or protected military or veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state or local laws.

Please visit our Careers Page to view our latest openings.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
